intro: Jasione montana var. echinata, commonly known as the hairy rock-jasione, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Jasione montana var. echinata is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in garden settings.
